title: Your pictures on the theme of 'night vision'
description: A selection of pictures from our readers on the theme of "night vision".

title: Coronavirus: Party conferences in a Covid world
description: They can't meet up in person this year, so what are the political parties doing instead?

title: Janusz Walus: Why far-right Polish football fans idolise a murderer in South Africa
description: Janusz Walus killed anti-apartheid leader Chris Hani in 1993, sparking fears of a racial civil war.

title: The Indian queens who modelled for the world's first vaccine
description: The mystery surrounding a 19th Century portrait and its role in one of the first immunisation campaigns.

title: 'I still spend so much time on the kids - that needs to change'
description: Sarah Dahia from Australia takes us through her week during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Emmy Awards 2020: Stars prepare to dial in for virtual ceremony
description: Nominated actors will have someone waiting outside their home to hand over an award if they win.

title: British Airways accused of snubbing refund request
description: A passenger is told she had accepted vouchers but BA's website did not list them as an option.

title: ‘Our foster child asked us to adopt him – by drawing himself on to a family photo’
description: George was neglected by his parents, then an adoption went wrong. There was only one family that he felt loved by.

title: How the oil industry made us doubt climate change
description: Energy companies stand accused of trying to downplay their contribution to global warming.

title: US Open: Rory McIlroy features in US Open third round best shots
description: Watch some of the best shots from day three of the US Open including a lovely chip from Rory McIlroy on the 17th hole at Winged Foot, New York.

title: The film within a film that tries to save lives
description: I Made This For You is a film about a group of friends trying to stop someone from taking their own life.

title: Singapore rolls out Covid tracing tokens
description: Thousands of devices are being distributed to vulnerable groups such as the elderly.

title: A bleak start for Man Utd - and tough early questions for Woodward
description: Manchester United's first game of the season did little to instil confidence that this will be a year of progress, writes Simon Stone.

title: Gareth Bale: Tottenham re-sign Real Madrid forward - watch some of his best Spurs goals
description: Watch some of the best goals Gareth Bale scored for Tottenham Hotspur after they re-sign the Real Madrid and Wales forward on a season-long loan.

title: New coronavirus rules 'inevitable': The view near No 10
description: People enjoying the sun yards from No 10 say there's a feeling of resignation about new virus measures.

title: Ruth Bader Ginsburg in pictures and her own words
description: A look back at some of the justice's greatest quotes on gender equality, law, and being remembered.

title: 'I never had problem with Bale', says Real coach Zidane
description: Real Madrid boss Zinedine Zidane has said he "never had a problem" with Gareth Bale, with the Wales forward set to rejoin Tottenham on loan.

title: Covid: PM considering new restrictions amid second coronavirus wave
description: Options being looked at in England include a ban on households mixing, and early pub closures.

title: Woman falls from car on M25 filming Snapchat video
description: It is "only by luck" the passenger wasn't seriously injured or killed, police say.

title: LeBron James unhappy with NBA MVP going to Giannis Antetokounmpo
description: The LA Lakers' LeBron James is not happy with being voted into second behind Milwaukee Bucks' Giannis Antetokounmpo in the NBA Most Valuable Player list.

title: Rochester shooting: Two dead after mass shooting in New York
description: Fourteen people have also been injured after the shooting at a house party in Rochester, New York.

title: Edition of Shakespeare's last play found in Scots college in Spain
description: A rare edition of The Two Noble Kinsmen was found in a volume dating from 1634.

title: Ginsburg tributes on the steps of the Supreme Court
description: Hundreds of people have been visiting the US Supreme Court to pay their respects to Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

title: Coronavirus: 'Rule-breaking Bolton pub crawl' saw cases rise
description: A holidaymaker who did not self-isolate and went on a night out spread the virus, a councillor says.

title: Liverpool agree £45m deal for Wolves forward Jota
description: Liverpool agree a deal to sign Wolverhampton Wanderers forward Diogo Jota - with young Reds defender Ki-Jana Hoever moving to Molineux for up to £13.5m.

title: Dominic Raab's bodyguard 'left gun on plane'
description: The foreign secretary was returning to London when the incident is reported to have happened.

title: Labour urges pay rises for care workers for 'Covid sacrifices'
description: Deputy Leader Angela Rayner says thousands of staff deserve a "real living wage" to get by.

title: ‘Liverpool are getting an absolute superstar’ - what Thiago will add to Klopp's side
description: What can Liverpool expect from new signing Thiago Alcantara? How does he compare to their other midfielders?

title: Syria war: US deploys reinforcements to Syria after Russia clashes
description: A US official says the move sends a "signal to Russia" to avoid "provocative actions" in Syria.

title: How many people does it take to oust a political leader?
description: How big does a protest need to be to topple a political leader? One estimate says 3.5% of the population will nearly always succeed.

title: The racist church bombing that shocked the world
description: In 1963, four young black girls were killed in a racist bomb attack at a church in Alabama.
